text: theology under sneeze to understand
itself as a humble co-worker alongside
the other areas where the human mind
seeks to grasp its world a science
understood a theology understood in this
way is able to draw from scientific
method draw from the humility of
learning from data and being wrong and
yet still speak its testimony to the
human pursuit of knowledge of God why
shouldn't we see both of those as
possible in today's world the opposite
is true as well there's a lot that
science needs to learn from theology the
science left to itself might think that
it's empirical methods the ways it knows
the world are the only things that exist
but a science that knows that there is
theology or philosophy or poetry as well
is a science that knows how strong it is
but knows that its area of
specialization is not all that exists
but science can gain from theology is an
awareness it's one field among many that
humans have multiple ways of intuiting
and grasping the world around them and
that that humbling power that broader
humanities disciplines and maybe even
theology bring is actually helpful to
the scientific spirit
[Music]
